intro: Dombeya anonyensis, commonly known as the African dombeya, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. The leaves are simple, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface, while the stems are woody and branched.
